comments.commentBody: The Kashmir/India problem is not unlike Israel/Palestine.  Palestine and Kashmir both seek independence.  Let them be.

Western and the UN silence on what New Delhi is upto in the Indian admistered Kashmir will, I believe, have the following consequences:

1. New Delhi will be emboldened and will become more belligerent. It will have no incentive to seek a solution to its Kashmir problem.
2. Kashmiri sufferering will rise and their urge for freedom from India will grow. Pushed to the wall, many will embrace violence.
3. Kashmiri suffering, already reaching the drawing rooms of the millions in the region thanks to sattelite TV and the Internet, will radicalise an entire generation of Muslims and millions of liberal non-Muslims.
4. The US efforts to rid the world of terrorism will become a pipe dream.
5. The nuclear armed India and Pakistan will never be too far away from engulfing the region into a nuclear holocaust.

All this to win a few commercial deals from a country that, despite its population, produces 1/10th of the US GDP!

are there any parallels here with England and Ireland?

Tell India to go have a chat with Ireland, and see what they've been through.

Ironic too is the fact that England once upon a time, had its claws in india! Is what we see today in India the result of British influence?

In 1947 India was Partitioned into Pakistan and India. According to the rules of partition Kashmir became part of India. Muslims who do not wish to be Indians have a choice. they should go to Pakistan, To facilitate this the Nehru Liaqat Pact should be revoked and Muslims should be allowed to freely migrate to their Muslim homeland. Those Kashmiri Muslims who wish to be not Indians should leave. Muslims are a majority in a very small part of Kashmir, the Valley which is only about 1500 sq miles. Jammu and ladakh which are much larger have non-Muslim majorities.

reading the comments made by those with Hindu names makes clear how history has been perverted by the deliberate efforts of xenophobic right-wing groups. The argument that Kashmir's occupation by Pandit Nehru was legal is pure baloney! In Kashmir the Indians claim that since the rajah signed the agreement to join India, the occupation became legal. But the same Indians turned around and by force took over Hyderabad, Junagarh, and at least two other princely states.

the reason India has any physical links with the state of Kashmir was made possible when the Mountbattens smitten by their love {it was very physical, according to the book "Indian Summer.) for Pandit Nehru physically changed the map drawn by Radcliffe and gave India Gurdaspur.

The author unwittingly presents an extraordinarily biased interpretation of recent events.  In referencing "mostly Hindu India and Muslim Pakistan" she ignores that India is a secular state.  She ignores the plight of a half a million Kashimiri Hindus (Kashmiri Pandits) displaced from Kashmir in 1989 by Islamist violence.  India is a diverse nation comprised of a myriad of cultures, languages, and ethnicities.  If Kashmir is ceded what next?  Nagaland?  Tamil Nadu?  Punjab?  By giving voice to a fringe radical minority (the fundamental Islamist Muslims), articles such as this neglect the greater imperative--finding a way to cultivate Kashmiris as citizens of a greater India so that they may feel Indian in the same way that Bengalis, Malayalis, and Gujaratis already do.
There are 7 million Kashmiri in India occupied Kashmir. There are only 2.9 million Tibetan in Tibet Autonomous Region. Maybe China should learn India's PR campaign on how to keep western media quiet.

I am tired of hearing India has the largest Muslim population blah blah..specially from people who live in the West and have no idea about second class status of Muslims in Hindu India. I am not saying all Hindus discriminate all Muslims, but this is a way of life- If a hindu and a muslim apply for a job, the hindu is likely to get the job. What about Gujarat massacres? If anything thinks all is well in Kashmir and it is just the handiworks for ISI and PakMil, let them continue their dream. In fact it is not just Kashmir, India has problems in other parts as well but Kashmir issue is most urgent.

While it is real tragedy, the independent Kashmir or Kashmir under Pakistan rule will prove disastrous to other minorities in the region, biggest being Hindus. Indian state must stop these atrocities but at the same time ensure that Kashmir remains integral part of India. A demand for a separate state based on religion has no place in democratic society.

To be honest, this is the first I've heard about this issue. I suspect I'm not alone. Do not blame those who do not speak out, who may have been in the dark for whatever period. And who, when we do hear something, need to do some research before lending in our own words, even if these words will be most likely supportive, once we can honestly arrive.
Th threat of militant and oppressive Islam is a threat to all free-thinkers, and especially to women, gays, and people of other religious faith.  India needs to hold the line.

This madness needs to end.
At Pakistan's and India's independence in 1947 Lord Mounbatten suggested a 'plebiscite' to determine the fate of Kashmir. In 1948 UN passed a resolution seeking the same.
Indians have repeatedly ignored both, and resorting to all kinds of subterfuge, including bribing Kashmiri leaders, just to hold on to this territory - a territory where the people don't want to be part of India.
HOLD THE DAMN REFERENDUM UNDER UN AUSPICES AND END THIS MADNESS.
Let the people decide.
People have to decide what they want? If they really want independence, then go for a full fledged movement. Please, don't waste their time or India's time.

It's much better that following essentials are understood...
The rebellion in Kashmir is not the handiwork of a few; it's overwhelmingly supported by the Valley population.
The region,for long,was a true symbol of a tolerant variety of Islam.
That such a region could over a few decades turn in to a collective voice for independance, based solely on religion,should open our mind to the future possibilities....the converts to militant Islam could turn Kashmir in to a land much more complex and difficult to handle than even Afghanistan.
Afghanistan,Pakistan and Kashmir all with ever lasting Taliban kind of indoctrinators could really pose a danger, just not to India alone, but to the whole world.
Kashmiris deserve a right to self determination and the people of the Valley, Ladakh and Jammu al should be allowed to exercise their right, subject to U.N/U.S.A/U.K/India/Pakistan joint supervision once Afghanistan and Pakistan reach a level of peace and tranquility, acceptable to all involved nations.In essence the right to self determination should be conceded, upfront,subject to the region turning stable and civilised.

To Moderators: I've corrected the spacing problem. Please post this and delete the first one.

The battle for Kashmir is only incidentally Islamic in nature. The true story is about the Soviet style policies that India has pursued for the last 60 years.India was a close ally of the Soviets and carefully learned the art of Sovietization. Much like the Soviets tried to turn a huge number of distinct peoples into one homogenous unit, India has been attempting to keep different people under the heel of the ruling Brahmin class.

Despite its best propaganda efforts India is NOT a functioning democracy. India does NOT respect human rights. India does NOT value
its diversity. India is nothing more than a poor person's Soviet Union. And just like the Soviets collapsed so too will India. I've been saying for the last year that Pakistan will not exist in its current form in 20 years. India may last longer, or not, but it certainly will not survive 50 years. India displays a wanton disregard for human rights in any kind of protest because it is very well aware that as soon as one uprising is successful the whole charade will come crashing down. Khalistan to the Sikhs, Nagaland to the Christians, the entire Northeast to the Maoists, Dravidistan, etc..

I should also add that it's one thing if Kashmir was the only insurgency in India. Ok, maybe the people are all terrorists and the government should be given full support. Two or three uprisings? Hmm... A little suspicious but we should give the "world's largest democracy" the benefit of the doubt. Four, five?? What is going on? Six, seven???? At a certain point you have to face reality and acknowledge that there is something woefully wrong with the central government of India.

India (Bharat) has never agreed to uphold the resolutions of the United Nation Security Council. We in the west use these resolutions for our convenience to stir up agitation if a country is not in line with our policy.

Do we want to eradicate the terrorist network in India and Pakistan?
If so, then we must help resolve the Kashmir problem in the Sub-Continent. Without resolving this issue, we can only dream of peace, it will never happen.
The Pakistanis did not orchestrate this current upheaval in Kashmir valley, but it is by the Kashmiris themselves. India has realized that this peaceful demonstration against Indian Rule is harmful for India. India must abide by the many resolutions of the United Nations.
India wants to be part of the UN Security Council. Since 1948-re Kashmir, we have many UN Security council resolutions that must be implemented before any consideration could be given to the expansion of the Security Council of the UN.

Do we only want the Muslim Governments to abide by the various UN Resolutions?
And exempt India and Israel to flaunt all the UN resolutions.

Human Rights violations are every day occurrences in occupied Kashmir, where are the Human Rights organizations.

In this day and age, it is impossible for any country to accept division on the basis of religion. Much less India - witness to creation of Pakistan in 1947, easily one of the worst political disasters of modern times in terms of human suffering. This must be understood by the promoters of such an ideology - along with the fact that such an agreement will have a disastrous effect on the nearly 20 million Muslims scattered all over India living by and large peacefully in an extremely secular society.

Any political solution to the Kashmir madness need to be predicated on the idea of non-divisibility of the nation. That leaves only the option of full autonomy as was promised way back by Nehru.

Indian Kashmir today consists of different regions - Kashmir valley with Muslim majority (Hindus have migrated out due to fear of persecution); Laddakh & Leh, a buddhist majority region and Jammu, a Hindu-dominated region. The upheaval is only in the Kashmir valley.

It is unfortunate that the generations over 60 years in Kashmir valley - with the moral support of mischievous Pakistan - have kept the fire smoldering and passed on the separatist idea to their next generations to suffer and not reconcile with a forward looking future with the fastest growing economies in the world.

There have been more free and fair elections in Indian Kashmir than all the Muslim world combined. The Chief minister and most of the cabinet is always Muslim. So the question is what is the problem. The separatist say they want freedom. It must be freedom to create a undemocratic fundamentalist Islamic society, and not the Jeffersonian democracy, which they already have.

Kashmir represents a very small minority of Muslims in India compared to rest of the country, even though they are in majority in Kashmir. Kashmiri message is that they do not want to live with Hindus. What happens if Hindus decide they do not want to live with Muslims in rest of India. Kashmir is taking a very dangerous position. We should be promoting multi religious and multi ethnic societies, and not be dividing people.

The greatest tragedy of Kashmir and its citizens is that they are mostly Muslims (Buddhists of Tibet, Christians of East Timor and Hindus of Sri Lanka (or for that matter the 3% Hindus of Kashmir)were all recognized as victims) and their enemy is a fifth of humanity, who as the comments here in NYTimes indicate, ready to abuse history to justify occupation and colonization of Kashmir (Perhaps a glance through "Hindu Rulers, Muslim subjects" by Mridu Rai would change their distorted minds). The obsession for Muslim's birth rates and the desire to dilute Kashmir with the destruction of Article 370 really convinced me that India is obsessed for the land called Kashmir, san Kashmiris. Given the amount of hate for Muslims in India and among the Indians diaspora in the US, I am surprised Muslims in Kerala, Assam, and Uttar Pradesh have not demanded liberation of their own.

Clearly, Kashmir should be independant of both India and Pakistan. The best kind of nation building and peace promotion is autonomously by the Kashmiris. If both Pakistan and India really cared for their welfare, they would get past the territoriality and posturing and smile, shake hands, and declare Kashmir, independant. India and Pakistan should recognize, that just like us, they won their independance from an empire, only to become one. Isnt it really sad that all nations ultimately rely on military power to confront one another? The war starts in the mind, so it can end there before the armies battle. Sometimes, its just plain wise to walk away from a problem, and it will solve itself.

India is not only the largest democracy but also largest secular country in the world. India is probably the only non-European country which has adopted secularism as central to its constitution.
Kashmir is a Lab where this test of "Secularism" will take place and will determine whether secularism can at all succeed in part of places where Islam is in majority. The root cause of all these protests are because Islam cannot coexist with other faiths and this is part of worldwide Muslim brotherhood uprising fueled by Saudi Wahhabi extremists. You have completely ignored the sufferings of Kashmir Hindus who are the aboriginals of that land, who have been massacred and hounded out of Kashmir and now live in squalid conditions all over India. India has already experienced religion based partition, another partition on similar lines will leave a trail of destruction not seen in history before. Indian Muslims who account for 15% of the population will suffer immensely as the rest of the country will reject the concept of secularism and democracy.
The need of the hour is therefore is to completely integrate Kashmir in letter and spirit with the rest of the nation and let Indians from other parts settle in Kashmir.

Cheers to Bloomberg for sticking to his opinion.  Heck, despite what you read and see on TV, the proposed location is not even at Ground Zero.  It's two blocks away. If we block this, I say we dismantle all religious-affiliated institutions in the vicinity (maybe the whole East Coast).

This is not about freedom of religion at face value. It's about seeing how far certain Muslims can get away with hiding behind our treasured American liberties. They know they can build their Muslim cultural and religious center anywhere they want, provided they raise the money for it. And nobody would care if they built their mosque anywhere else. But they insist on building it right next to Ground Zero. They know they the city cannot deny them the permit because of the First Amendment, regardless of any other sensitivities and concerns. If they are so-called moderates, then why don't they see their petition to build right there as callous and insensitive? Or that it could be viewed as outrageous? The only words I can use to describe Mayor Bloomberg are unprintable!

Listen, New York. The tip of lower Manhattan hasn't exactly been home to a tightly knit Muslim community. If these people get their way, this hallowed place will be an international Muslim destination. Are we really prepared to hear Muslim prayers over minaret loudspeakers five times a day at Ground Zero?

I applaud the Mayor's stance against this disgraceful religious intolerance wholeheartedly.  Compared to our craven Governor and the myriad right-wingers who habitually appeal to bigotry, the mayor has stood up for what's best about America. I'm sure his family's history deeply affected his views on this; it should.  I did not vote for Bloomberg but his speech renewed my pride as a citizen of this City.  Bravo!

With his money, why should he care what the rest of us think?  He never did, anyway, and, as we've seen, his money will buy anything, including three elections and suspension of term limits, and put the landmarks preservation law in his pocket to do his will.
